definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: So what happens in the very likely event they find more tainted products?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，如果在整治中發現了更加有害的產品呢？

sentences.english: Jack subdues the suspect but realizes Hampton has been shot.
sentences.chinese: 傑克制服了嫌犯，但他發現傑西被子彈擊中了。

sentences.english: His body was found in the Floor hole.
sentences.chinese: 他的軀體發現在樓棟裏。

sentences.english: The water ran for hours before the leak was found.
sentences.chinese: 漏洞發現之前，水已流了數小時。

sentences.english: The insect found itself entangled in an inextricable net.
sentences.chinese: 昆蟲發現自己被纏在一個逃脫不掉的羅網中。

sentences.english: They found that the higher their level of social interaction, the better their cognitive functioning.
sentences.chinese: 他們發現，社會交往越多的人認知表現越好。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the fire is discovered soon after it has started.
sentences.chinese: 幸好火勢剛起就立即被發現了。

sentences.english: Consequently, you will find that almost every one owns either a watch or a clock.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你會發現幾乎每個人都擁有一隻表或一個鐘。

sentences.english: The travellers were dismayed to find the bridge had been wash away.
sentences.chinese: 旅行者們發現橋被衝跑了，很沮喪。

sentences.english: Finding should change standard of care, which is 4 doses every 3 weeks, researchers say.
sentences.chinese: 研究員說該發現將改變每3周4次給藥的治療標準。

sentences.english: The findings are based on detailed radar measurements of ice caps on Mars.
sentences.chinese: 這些發現是基於對火星冰冠的詳細雷達測定數據。

sentences.english: Scientists find that hard-working people live longer than average men and women.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們發現努力工作的人比一般的人更有生活。

sentences.english: One was the discovery by Allied troops of the German death camps.
sentences.chinese: 一個是發現由德國死亡集中營盟軍部隊。

sentences.english: These materials are found capable of withstanding high temperature and high pressure.
sentences.chinese: 發現這些材料能承受高溫高壓。

sentences.english: Boeing says it found problems in the process used to reach the decision.
sentences.chinese: 波音公司表示他在過去做出決定的過程中發現了問題。

sentences.english: Vietnam also has reported recent cases of blue ear decease ( disease ).
sentences.chinese: 越南也報告說最近發現藍耳豬的病例。

definition: to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
to press charges/to file a complaint
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
